alert.note: Alert for San Miguel; Santa Fe (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 1:00PM MDT until July 28 at 3:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central, north central, and northeast New Mexico, including the following counties, in central New Mexico, Torrance. In east central New Mexico, Guadalupe. In north central New Mexico, Santa Fe. In northeast New Mexico, San Miguel. * WHEN...Until 400 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 100 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Clines Corners and Milagro. - This includes the following highways... Highway 285 between Mile Markers 246 and 263. Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 212 and 257. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
